data.title: Shader Variable POSITION Bug
data.body:
Windows 10 Godot Version 2.1


When calling the variable POSITION in a fragment shader it turns the whole scene white. Don't know if this happens to 3d objects but it happens with 2d objects.


Create a 2d sprite attach a shader and in the Fragment tab call the POSITION variable.
[shader.txt](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/681614/shader.txt)

data.title: PopupMenu's clear method doesn't remove signals
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** 2.1 latest


**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

```
PopupMenu.clear()
PopupMenu.add_item("Hello", 0)
PopupMenu.connect("item_pressed", self, "IGNContextMenu")
```

And if ran again, we get a signal already connected error. Just curious if this is intended or not. The `.clear` definition says `Clear the popup menu, in effect removing all items` If all items are removed, their signals should be also

data.title: Allow closing a script tab without saving
data.body:
I added a *Discard* button to the confirmation popup. I also changed the *Ok* button to a more explicit *Save* button.
Fixes #7378

data.title: variable in autoload is recognized as constant
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.2 alpha with current master head c9366f8b563c186b4d0ab09088d09d47580f749d

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
variable in autoload script is recognized as constant, so can't assign it

**Steps to reproduce:**
global.gd (autoload)
```gdscript
extends Node

var not_const_var

func _ready():
	pass
```

node.gd
```gdscript
extends Node

func _ready():
	global.not_const_var = []
```

when run, debugger says `Parser Error: Can't assign to constant`
maybe regression with #7390?

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Add set_camera_pos method to Camera2D
data.body: This method can be handy for some custom stuff with a Camera2D.

data.title: Add the 'finished' signal to AnimatedSprite
data.body:
This PR adds the `finished` signal to AnimatedSprite.
If the animation is looping it will be emitted everytime the last frame is reached.

Fixes #7316

data.title: Vertical scrolling instead of zooming with the mouse wheel
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10, Godot 2.2

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

There does not seem to be an option to change the mouse wheel to do vertical scrolling instead of zooming...?

I'd actually suggest to change the default to vertical scrolling - most graphics software do this for a good reason - and then zoom with CTRL + mouse wheel. And add a setting to switch this.

EDIT: I'm of course talking about the 2D editor.

data.title: Discussion: Changing the import/export system
data.body:
Hi guys! This thread is for discussing the possibility of changing the Import/Export system in Godot 3.0.

Current one works by having two separate import and export systems. It works, but it's complex for a lot of users, as you generally need to have a separate directory for stuff you want to import, and also separate options for the stuff you want to export.

As a result, the code is difficult to maintain, generally buggy, and not that user friendly.

My proposal is to move to a system more similar to how Unity works, where you just copy your assets like .dae , .wav, .png, to the project directory.. then Godot does a forced import of the assets, yet your code can keep referencing those files as if they were native.  At export Godot will just export it's native assets and replace internally.

After seeing a lot of people working with Unity this way, I really think it's difficult to deny that it's more user friendly. It will also make the import/export process and code _much_ simpler.

Any thoughts?

data.title: [Suggestion] - Add Clip Option property for Control nodes
data.body:
Basically all of [VisualServer's](http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/classes/class_visualserver.html?) docs are undocumented, however, there are some amazing features in there that arn't really easily accessible for new godoters.

One example:
http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/classes/class_visualserver.html?highlight=canvas_item_set_clip#class-visualserver-canvas-item-set-clip

More info [here](https://godotengine.org/qa/675/how-to-clip-child-controls-to-parent-controls-rect-bounds)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10387670/21582631/3a444410-d015-11e6-8eca-5f9898151741.png)

I'm going to start filling out descriptions as well and submit a pr later

data.title: Cannot to destroy the light in code while destroying the node2d.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot official 2.1 stable version and Windows 10 Pro.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I wanted to remove the loaded node2D which had the light2d in it by code and the light did not remove. There are two scenes (Levels) and I change them in my main screen scene by removing the last scene from the node2d and loading, adding new scene from next level.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create scene with Node2D as the first node with name "World" and then create light in it. After that create another scene with Node and attach a script to this node and create node2d in it with name "Level". In the script, if the "Level" has the "World" node then get_node("Level/World").queue_free() and load the "World" from another scene.


**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Feature request : Ability to select instanced scenes from the viewport.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Any version.
 Any OS

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
doesn't seem like you can select an instance scene from inside the 3d viewport when the instanced scene is apart of another scene.

**Steps to reproduce:**
create an instance 3D scene. add that scene to another 3D scene. try to select the instance.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
I know instance feature is broken at the moment. don't know if the devs know about this so just putting it out there.

data.title: Class (instead of file) based script assignment in editor
data.body:
Following some discussion with Karroffel and getting neikeq's GodotSharp module functional, I had an idea to make script/class organization easier, by having Godot automatically parse the project files for all classes/scripts and having a popup that lists them (with search bar and filters) to select a class rather than pointing a given node to a file directly. For example, on a Node2D selecting a subclass would make this window appear:

![untitled3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7831502/21578541/1dd5ecc0-cf52-11e6-9c8c-b4e00f5953cf.png)

For GDScript/VisualScript, the class path could either be the file path in dot notation, or to further reduce the dependency on the file system's organization, GD/VS could have namespaces added or simply always appear top-level with no namespaces.

XCode operates similarly where the selection menu for a custom subclass on a view/component will list all of the classes in the project that inherit from the required type.

data.title: Bucket fill preview
data.body: Added a preview of which tiles the bucket tool will fill. I remember Tiled does this and i find it handy, so I implemented it for fun. It can be turned off with an editor setting.

data.title: Option to set Position2D gizmos length
data.body: Position2D has a fixed length gizmos that when working with low-resolution art gets really chaotic. This can be solved sometimes by scaling down the node, but there are times where that is not possible and we either settle with a giant gizmos or rage and flip the table. Unity uses a zoom-like solution, but I propose just a inspector setting; I find it gives more freedom to your choices.

data.title: Make sound bar look nicer and more intuitive
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
All OS-es that can run the editor -- all Godot versions

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Currently, we are getting lots of duplicate questions on QA about the red-yellow-green bar in the top-left corner of the editor (e.g. https://godotengine.org/qa/11180/what-this-bar-is-supposed-to-be as a recent one).

Speaking about it with @Einlander on IRC, we decided that it would be better to make it with two bars (for stereo), and to add a sound or headphones icon, just to make it more obvious (@djrm :wink:). E.g.:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5276727/21577047/0bafb046-cf55-11e6-8e0b-5ea1dd0af223.png)


~~**Steps to reproduce:**~~
~~**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):~~

data.title: Input.is_mouse_button_pressed Misreports
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Godot_v2.1.1-stable_win64.exe


**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected): I was trying to detect if the left mouse button was not down, and sometimes it reports that it is not down even when the bit mask claims otherwise.


**Steps to reproduce:** In any project, add the following code to a processing node:
```
func _process(delta):
	if Input.is_mouse_button_pressed(BUTTON_LEFT) == false:
		if Input.get_mouse_button_mask() & BUTTON_LEFT != 0:
			printt(OS.get_ticks_msec(), Input.is_mouse_button_pressed(BUTTON_LEFT), Input.get_mouse_button_mask())
```
Click around a few times -- eventually you'll see printouts claiming that `Input.get_mouse_button_pressed(BUTTON_LEFT) == False` while simultaneously `Input.get_mouse_button_mask() == 1`.

This seems to happen consistently after double-clicks.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[Example.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/679421/Example.zip)

data.title: Cannot apply multiple diffuse materials in Godot
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Fedora 25, Godot 2.1.1 (stable)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I am attempting to load a 3D model exported from Blender. The mesh exported just fine but the mesh uses multiple textures, and Godot seems to be lacking a consciousness of which areas are to be applied to the mesh.

**Steps to reproduce:**
I used some simple colors to demonstrate this
![enter image description here][1]


So I apply image textures to it by clicking Material slot > Edit > Textures/Diffuse within the editor. And after the image texture is applied it looks like this:
![enter image description here][2]
So it textured the spoiler correctly but it is not applying to say the windshield because the texture for the windshield is in a different texture. There are multiple slots for materials but loading the other png files in them does not seem to do me much good. Here is a screenshot of what my editor looks like while I am doing this
![enter image description here][3]


  [1]: https://b2aeaa58a57a200320db-8b65b95250e902c437b256b5abf3eac7.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/media_entries/12665/Selection_013.medium.png
  [2]: https://b2aeaa58a57a200320db-8b65b95250e902c437b256b5abf3eac7.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/media_entries/12666/Selection_014.png
  [3]: https://b2aeaa58a57a200320db-8b65b95250e902c437b256b5abf3eac7.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/media_entries/12667/Selection_012.medium.png

data.title: The remote inspector spams errors if the selected node isn't in the scene tree anymore
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7, Godot 2.1.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When a node is removed from the scene while it's selected in the remote inspector the engine will spam the error: "Condition '!is_inside_tree()' is true. returned: NodePath()" as long as the removed node is selected remote inspector and the remote inspector is open.

**Steps to reproduce:**

- Run a project
- Select a node via the remote inspector
- Remove the node with the remove_child method
- Watch the errors flow in

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[remote inspector bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/677399/remote.inspector.bug.zip)

data.title: Code-style formatter in editor
data.body:
In my favorite IDE (Eclipse CDT at the moment) there's a feature to automatically apply a configurable codestyle to your currently opened file. I'd like to implement something like it for the godot editor also. It was suggested to me to open an issue to discuss this.

The idea is as follows, there would be a project setting for several code-style related items such as parenthesis hugging of variables. When set to 'hugging' it would change 
`def my_func ( stuff )` to `def my_func(stuff)` when requested through a keyboard shortcut.

Things to consider:
- parenthesis hugging for function parameters, function calls, etc. (separate options)
- spacing for lists (1,2,3) vs (1, 2, 3)
- line wrapping
- variable naming (case) snake_case CamelCase etc.
- hash formatting (multiple lines?)

Question I have are: would this be interesting for upstream, if so should I write it in gdscript or make changes to the editor?

data.title: Update DebugMesh when NavMesh changes
data.body: Fixes #7371

data.title: Disallow assignment to constants and expressions
data.body: Fixes #6221, fixes #6824

data.title: A small change to the project screen
data.body: Thinking to help a little in the development of the engine, I decided to start to modify the appearance a little. I moved the "quit" button under "remove" (separated by a large space "auto resized") and too the engine version is center to the bottom. Certainly a minimal change but gives a "fresher air" and better organization to the projects screen. I hope they are interested in design modifications. I have more ideas, but I'm trying to apply them little by little.

data.title: Document licenses of thirdparty libraries and code snippets exhaustively
data.body:
As you can see here: [minimax.h](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/thirdparty/libmpcdec/mpc/minimax.h)
And on many other places around the code, Godot uses BSD and LGPL software without informing the users. 
I'm not a lawyer but I think while on source version might not be an issue, is totally not fair to distribute without at least a LICENSES file that lists those libraries.

I'd put this issue to a high priority since those people who made the libraries must have their credits given.
It might sound stupid, but tomorrow, the same thing could happen to me and you.

data.title: ButtonArray aligmnent issues
data.body:
Seen on Godot 2.1.1

ButtonArray text alignment is always set to left and there is no option in the editor to change it.
Align modes have been exposed but have no effect.
Side note: the aligment is not initialized in the C++ constructor so it's most of the time set to BEGIN, by guess.
